page.title: 15Hunting in Leighfield
page.content: Leighfield is in the centre of the best hunting country of the Cottesmore Hunt,Priors Coppice (830055) and Launde Park Wood (803038) being two of the most important fox coverts. The objects of hunting are to cull excess foxes and to provide sport. Cubbing takes place in September and October when the young hounds are taught about hunting and the excess cubs are culled by holding up the covert and so confining the foxes and hounds. The hunting season is from November to March and the hunt goes across Leighfield about once a fortnight. The earths in the woods are stopped on the morning of the hunt to keep the foxes above ground and encourage them to run from one wood to another. Two new fox coverts have been planted close to the River Chater in recent years.
